Context: George Brown College prepared graduates for emerging jobs in new sectors through innovative programs that blend theory with experiential learning, applied research, and entrepreneurship opportunities. The college has three campuses in Toronto that support the growth of the city and its diverse communities. George Brown is integral to Ontario's social and economic success. The college develops programs in consultation with industry to meet the rapidly changing needs of the labour market and connects employers to top talent. Experiential learning is a priority at George Brown, with students having meaningful access to industry through work-integrated learning opportunities, industry projects, and capstone projects.

Context: The college, George Brown, offers industry projects, interactive simulations, capstone projects, and other experiential learning opportunities for students, excluding upgrading and preparatory programs. According to a survey, nearly 2/3 of students cited work experience opportunities as what sets George Brown apart from other colleges and universities. Students have also completed work or study abroad experiences to gain international experience. The following soft skills are emphasized at the college: self-awareness, self-regulation, stress management, resilience, interpersonal communication, empathy, social responsibility, openness, adaptability to cultural diversity, collaborative teamwork. Additionally, students are encouraged to develop flexibility, resilience, initiative, creativity, entrepreneurship, openness to continual lifelong learning, analytical and critical thinking, and complex problem-solving skills. Context: The college has over 100,000 square feet of learning and research space. It is home to the Innovation Exchange, a living lab for testing commercial ideas and user functionality. In 2021, they will construct Ontario's first mass-timber, low-carbon institutional building named The Arbour. The Arbour will house the School of Computer Technology, School of Architectural Studies, a childcare center, and a research hub focused on mass-timber construction. The modern, sustainable design by Moriyama & Teshima Architects and Acton Ostry Architects has already received awards: the Sustainability Prize at the 2019 MIPIM/Architectural Review Future Project Awards, and the First Award in the Institutional Concept category at Rethinking the Future's 2018 Architecture.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/George Brown College Impact Report 2018â2019 - Teaching Tomorrow's Skills Today.txt

Context: The college, George Brown, received the Canadian Architect Award of Excellence in 2018. They have full-time students numbering 922 (including apprentices), and an undisclosed number of part-time students. Additionally, there were Continuing Education registrations. George Brown was named one of Greater Toronto's Top 100 Employers for 2019.
